result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Samuel Peterson

records.addlTxt: Status Conference set for 10/31/22 at 2:30 p.m. rescheduled due to all-day contested family hearing. JA attempted to advise Defendant by phone, but the mailbox was not set up, so JA was not able to leave a voicemail. JA advised attys by phone on 10/31/22.  Status conference to be rescheduled with attorneys.  gll

Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond, includes 22CF547 and 22CF579. Filed by Atty. Dolfi. kma   to rg
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:48 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Nathan Samuel Peterson, Defendant Nathan Samuel Peterson appeared by video. INCLUDES 22CF547 and 22CF579. Court reviews file. ADA Ellenwood requests additional time for resolution, DE is currently in treatment. Speedy prelim waived. Atty. Dolfi requests to suspend testing. Court orders DE's testing is suspended while DE is in treatment. Court sets STC, Zoom approved. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned: 4:00 PM. kma
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: filed by Abrianna Dolfi; hereby appointing Atty Dolfi. arc
Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:40 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Aaron Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court for Defendant for today. Includes 22CF547 and 22CF579. ADA Damrau states DE hasn't been complying with testing. Atty Schmidt states DE was released at 10 PM last night after JSC was closed. Court states DE was supposed to call JSC as the bond stated. Atty Schmidt states Atty Dolfi will be appointed by PD. Court orders DE to test at JSC today (8/24). Waive speedy prelim. Court sets STC via Zoom. Court may consider signature bond at a later date. gll
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:29 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court. Defendant Nathan Samuel Peterson in court, in custody. Includes 22CF547- RW/INIT and 22CF579- INIT. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Atty Harrelson states DE is currently on Probation in MN. Court orders bond. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court to consider modifying bond if confirmation of treatment is provided to the court. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:40 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Includes 22CF547 and 22CF579.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing 1 time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
